definition: to regard it as an honor (idiom)

to draw (e.g. a bow)/to pull/to stretch sth/to extend/to lengthen/to involve or implicate in/to attract/to lead/to guide/to leave/to provide evidence or justification for/old unit of distance equal to 10 丈[zhang4], one-thirtieth of a km or 33.33 meters
to use/by means of/according to/in order to/because of/at (a certain date or place)
abbr. for Israel 以色列[Yi3 se4 lie4]
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)

sentences.english: Adventists take pride in originating in the Disappointment.
sentences.chinese: 复临信徒因出身于那次大失望，能引以为荣。

sentences.english: This must have been one of the proudest moments of his busy and hard working life.
sentences.chinese: 这一定是他劳碌工作的一生中最引以为荣的时刻之一。

sentences.english: The town boasts a world-famous art gallery.
sentences.chinese: 这个镇子引以为荣的是有个闻名于事的美术馆。

sentences.english: There was no success there to be proud of.
sentences.chinese: 没有可引以为荣的成功。

sentences.english: And it should make every one of us proud.
sentences.chinese: 它应该令我们每个人引以为荣。

definition: to admire/to hold in high esteem
to admire/to revere/to look up to
to recount history but omit one's ancestors (idiom); to forget one's roots
to honor sb as a God (idiom); to revere/to worship/to deify/to make a holy cow of sth/to put sb on a pedestal
